text: Elihu Rebukes Job and His Three Friends
Then these three men ceased from answering Job because he \add was\add* righteous in his \add own\add* eyes.

So Elihu the son of Barakel the Buzite, from the clan of Ram, ⸤became angry⸥.\f + \fr 32:2 \ft Literally “the nose of Elihu became hot” \f* ⸤He became angry⸥\f + \fr 32:2 \ft Literally “His nose became hot” \f* at Job because he justified himself rather than God,
and ⸤he became angry⸥\f + \fr 32:3 \ft Literally “his nose became hot” \f* at his three friends because they had not found an answer, and they had declared Job guilty.
Thus Elihu had waited for Job ⸤to speak⸥\f + \fr 32:4 \ft Literally “in words” \f* because ⸤they were older than he⸥.\f + \fr 32:4 \ft Literally “they \fq were \ft older than he as far as days” \f*
When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of the three men, ⸤he became angry⸥.\f + \fr 32:5 \ft Literally “his nose became hot” \f*
Then Elihu the son of Barakel the Buzite ⸤spoke up⸥\f + \fr 32:6 \ft Literally “answered”; see NET \f* and said,
“⸤I am young⸥,\f + \fr 32:6 \ft Literally “Young I \fq am \ft as far as days” \f* but\f + \fr 32:6 \ft Or “and” \f* you\f + \fr 32:6 \ft Plural \f* are old;
therefore I feared and became afraid of explaining my knowledge to you.\f + \fr 32:6 \ft Plural \f*
I thought,\f + \fr 32:7 \ft Or “said” \f* ‘Let days\f + \fr 32:7 \ft Compare the idiom of “as far as days” in vv. \xt 4 \ft and 6 \f* speak,
and let many years teach wisdom.’
“Truly, it \add is\add* a spirit in a human being,
and the breath of Shaddai teaches them.
\add It is\add* not ⸤the aged⸥\f + \fr 32:9 \ft Literally “many \fq in days \ft ” \f* \add who\add* are wise,
or\f + \fr 32:9 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* \add it is not\add* \add the\add* elders \add who\add* understand justice.
Therefore I say, ‘Listen to me;
let me also declare my knowledge myself.’
“Look, I waited for your\f + \fr 32:11 \ft Plural \f* words;
I listened for your\f + \fr 32:11 \ft Plural \f* insight,
until you searched out ⸤what to say⸥.\f + \fr 32:11 \ft Literally “words,” or “sentences” \f*
And I directed my attention to you;\f + \fr 32:12 \ft Plural \f*
and, look, there is no \add one\add* for Job \add who\add* refuted,
answering his words among you.
So do not say, ‘We have found wisdom;
let God refute him, not a man.’
But\f + \fr 32:14 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* he did not direct \add his\add* words\f + \fr 32:14 \ft Or “sentences,” or “what he said” \f* to me,
and I will not answer him with your\f + \fr 32:14 \ft Plural \f* words.
“They are dismayed; they no longer answer;
⸤they have nothing to say⸥.\f + \fr 32:15 \ft Literally “words fail from them,” or “sentences fail from them,” or “what to say fails from them” \f*
And I have waited because they do not speak,
because they stand \add there\add* \add and\add* no longer answer.
I myself will answer my share also;
I myself will declare my knowledge also,
for I am full of words;\f + \fr 32:18 \ft Or “sentences,” or “what to say” \f*
⸤the spirit within me⸥\f + \fr 32:18 \ft Literally “the spirit of my stomach” \f* urges me.
“Look, my internal organs \add are\add* like unopened wine,
like new wineskins it\f + \fr 32:19 \ft Antecedent is “wine” \f* is \add ready\add* to burst open.
Let me speak ⸤that I may find relief⸥;\f + \fr 32:20 \ft Literally “and let it find relief for me” \f*
let me open my lips, and let me answer.
⸤Please let me not show partiality to anyone⸥,\f + \fr 32:21 \ft Literally “Not please I will lift up face of a man” \f*
and let me not show flattery to human beings,
for I do not know \add how\add* ⸤to flatter⸥,\f + \fr 32:22 \ft Literally “I will flatter” \f*
\add else\add* my Maker would ⸤soon⸥\f + \fr 32:22 \ft Literally “like little” \f* put an end to me.
